basics.name: Janel Joson
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

highlights: Answer phone calls and provide clear instruction to troubleshoot technology issues
Respond to email inquiries to offer additional tech support and accomodations

work.position: Student Coordinator/Outreach Worker (Office of Multicultural Student Serivces)
work.summary: Hawaii Undergraduate Initiative (HUI) is a summer leadership program providing a free 3-credit summer college course for a select group of incoming freshmen at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. In addition to the summer course, HUI offers engaging and insightful workshops on using university resources, exploring academics/careers and developing writing/math skills. All HUI participating scholars will be paired with a Peer Mentor who will support and assist them in their transition from high school to college.
highlights: Create recruitment media and advertisements for the HUI Summer Program to increase registration rates
Organize training activities for team of Peer Mentors
Promote campus events and resources to engage and assist first-year students
Supported customers in locating merchandise by maintaining a high-level of product knowledge
Assisted in floor moves, display maintenance, and housekeeping
Helped ring up sales and bag merchandise at POS machines

awards.title: Provost Achievement Scholarship
